intro: Agaloma ciliata, commonly known as the threadleaf agaloma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy leaves and spikes of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it blooms during the summer months. Agaloma ciliata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant.
